bioghist.p: Raymond Barnett Knudsen (1919-2001) was a Presbyterian minister, consultant, and author of a weekly syndicated newspaper column entitled "The Counselor." He was a 1948 graduate of McCormick Theological Seminary. He served in pastorates in Illinois and New York and was Special Assistant General Secretary and Executive Director for the Department of Financial Development of the National Council of the Churches of Christ in the USA. In 1977 he joined the staff of Church Development, Inc., as Director of the National Consultation on Financial Development. In addition to his weekly column, Knudsen published book reviews in the field of psychology and religion.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of personal and professional papers of Raymond B. Knudsen. The collection includes records of Knudsen's time at seminary, his ministry, his work with the National Council of Churches, his publications, and his work as a consultant. Materials include records and correspondence from Knudsen's ministries in Colorado, Iowa, Indiana, Illinois, and New York, from the mid 1930s to the 1970s; scrapbooks of clippings and programs, 1934-1946; seminary papers and files, 1943-1947; records from his time as Director for Broadcasting for the Illinois and Springfield Councils of Churches, 1952-1963; issues of "The Counselor," 1955-1994; "Counselor" recording disks; "Counselor" television formats; manuscripts of Developing Dynamic Stewardship and Models for Ministry (both 1978); financial records; sermon notes and outlines; files related to The Counselor's Association's incorporation and its work for the Presbytery of Greenbrier; and papers related to Kundsen's position as Special Assistant General Secretary for the National Council of the Churches of Christ.
